Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer wants you to know that the Xbox 360 "isn't a gaming console." Rather, Steve Ballmer believes the 360- along with Kinect- acts as a complete family entertainment center. It's a place to socialize. It's a place to watch TV. We have Hulu coming. It's the only system where you are the controller. the incident reflects a new, more reactive attitude toward slights emanating from Larry Page, the Google co-founder who will become CEO in April and is considered more volatile and less diplomatic than outgoing CEO Eric Schmidt . Google's complaint is the height of hypocrisy. The company's entire business model is built on the use of other people's content usually without bothering to seek permission, said John Simpson, from Consumer Watchdog's Inside Google research team. Google's allegations are an attempt to make Microsoft look bad for doing what every search provider does constantly: analyze competitors' search engines
